# 11 Best Goal-Tracking Apps That’ll Give You a Gentle Nudge When You Need It

It's never too late to make a positive life change.

By Melanie Yates

Updated: Jan 14, 2021

Stocksy

Whether your resolutions haven't quite worked out as planned, or you've been
trying to kick the same habit for years, finding a sustainable way to track
your goals every day makes them feel more real, and less like an abstract,
unattainable concept.

### How Goal-Tracking Apps Can Help

If you've ever scrolled through your smartphone's app store, you've probably
noticed the many habit- and goal-tracking apps that it offers. While these
make the practice of goal-setting and -keeping more convenient, it's a good
idea to think about what exactly you're trying to accomplish with this form of
digital daily tracking.

According to clinical psychologist and author Dr. Paula Durlofsky, “Setting
goals takes conscious planning and implementing the necessary smaller steps.”
Goals like running a marathon, writing a novel, or getting a degree aren’t the
types of things you can realistically check off on an app, so you'll want to
find a way to work toward these goals by breaking them down into smaller, more
doable, daily tasks.

But what if you fall off track? As anyone who's ever made a New Year's
resolution knows, keeping good habits every day is easier said than done.

“A common mistake people make when making healthy and positive changes in
one’s life is the belief that if they don’t stick to their new behaviors 100%
of the time, they lose the hope that they can change ... But, in reality, this
type of thinking, which psychologists refer to as a cognitive distortion known
as ‘black and white thinking’ or ‘all or none thinking’ undermines the fact
that everyone makes mistakes or that we all, at times, drift off course.”

Durlofsky advises that people approach these types of digital trackers with an
attitude of self-compassion. Think of them as providing gentle accountability.

### How We Chose

To find these 11 best goal-setting apps, we searched the top of the
Productivity charts of the Apple and Google Play app stores, considering goal-
tracking apps with thousands of user reviews, and we downloaded the free
version onto our Apple device where applicable.

These multifaceted, user-favorite apps are all easy to learn and navigate,
customizable (to a certain extent), upbeat and motivating, and they offer push
notifications and various weekly and monthly views for you to keep tabs on
your progress. Keep in mind that nearly all of these goal-tracking apps are
free to download but have a premium version that unlocks full app
functionality.

DONE

1

## DONE

 _Free, or $39.99/year_

DOWNLOAD NOW

The DONE app neatly combines goal- and habit-tracking into one cleanly
designed place. Users can set “build habits” or “quit habits” to encourage
them to meet or stay beneath a designated number per day, week, or month.

Every completed habit allows users to continue their success streak, which is
meant to encourage them to keep going. The app also provides weekly, monthly,
and yearly summaries, so that they can see their peaks and valleys over any
length of time. Plus, this data can even be exported to a CSV file.

We really like this app's custom color display and its easy-to-edit multiple
reminders — it also offers passcode protection. Just keep in mind that the
free version offers very limited habit-tracking (just three habits), while the
paid subscription is unlimited.

Aloe Bud

2

## Aloe Bud

 _Free, or $4.99 for a lifetime subscription_

DOWNLOAD NOW

Aloe Bud is a habit-tracking app with a focus on self-care, and it looks like
it was engineered to be Gen Z catnip with its cute, calming, 8-bit graphics.
Its positive reviews also caught our eye, with users saying "It's absolutely
beautiful" and "The reminders are very gentle and motivational."

The app is unique from others on this list, as it only provides 11 different
categories of tracking (like move, breathe, hydrate, and rest) and gives users
the choice to check off a habit on a particular schedule or pause to reflect
with a short prompt. These activities aren’t able to be customized but are
general enough to apply to most people. The paid subscription allows users to
customize the messaging a bit more.

While limited, it is a nice digital respite from the other apps on our phone
that tend to make us more anxious than calm.

Strides

3

## Strides

 _Free, or $4.99/month, $29.99/year, $79.99/lifetime access_

 ****DOWNLOAD NOW  

What's the difference between a non-starter goal and a SMART one? SMART goals
feel less amorphous, because they're Specific, Measurable, Achievable,
Relevant, and Timely, and this app uses these same categories to set you up
for success.  

On Strides, you can set daily habits that are relevant to achieving any goal
you have in mind, by any deadline. Each day, you hold yourself accountable to
these goals by checking off the habits on your checklist.

Each successful daily habit will be highlighted in green, while skipped habits
are red to incentivize you to not break your stride.

Forest

4

## Forest: Stay Focused

 _$1.99 for lifetime access_

DOWNLOAD NOW  

There are lots of Pomodoro-style timer apps out there to help you get work
done uninterrupted, but the Forest app is one of the most unique ones we've
found. We like this distraction-busting app's cute, gamified approach.

Start by opening the app and selecting your timer length — you can choose
between 10 minutes and 2 hours. Once you begin your timer, a seed is planted
and will start to grow for as long as the timer is running. But if you exit
out of the app to answer texts or scroll around on social media, your tree
will die! This app can also sync up with its desktop Chrome Extension, so you
can't cheat.

If you can successfully keep your tree growing until your time's up, you can
collect coins. The coins are a great bonus because you can either use them to
grow different types of trees (we told you this app was cute), or you can use
up to 2,500 of your accumulated coins to help plant a real tree through the
app's partner, the nonprofit organization, Trees for the Future.

Way of Life

5

## Way of Life

 _Free, or $7.99 for lifetime access_

DOWNLOAD NOW  

This top-rated habit-tracker app also takes a daily checklist approach, and it
layers in some note-taking functionality as well, if you’d like to give
context as to why you didn’t meet a certain goal for the day. The longer you
keep using it, the more useful it’ll be, as you can zoom out on your week,
quarter, or year, to see how much progress you’ve made.

Even though this app uses a chain approach as a visible encouragement to keep
up with your daily and weekly goals, we like that it doesn't feel like you're
starting from square one if you happen to miss a day.  

Fabulous

6

## Fabulous

 _Free, or $35.99/year_

DOWNLOAD NOW

Fabulous is a great app for those who want to fine-tune their daily routines
to experience happier mornings and more productive workdays.

The app has a science-based approach, where all of its pre-planned sessions
are created in collaboration with experts or are based on data supporting
stress-reduction techniques and positive psychology.

Not only can Fabulous users track daily goals but the premium version of this
app integrates various programs for dieting, fitness, and mindfulness
exercises. Its eye-catching graphics help make the journey a little more
aesthetically pleasing as well.

Habit-Bull

7

## HabitBull

 _Free, or $5.00 for lifetime access_

DOWNLOAD NOW

The HabitBull app has a clean, colorful interface that'll actually make you
want to open it up again and again. Each day presents a fresh color-coded
checklist of chosen habits that users can either check yes/no or enter a
number to denote whether or not a goal was met. Users can look back on their
weeks and months to keep track of anything from flossing to hours of sleep to
fitness to making Zoom dates with friends.  

We like that it offers tons of flexibility for your own goal-setting style,
whether you want to chart your daily tasks in streaks or just punch in your
progress periodically.

HabitBull's push notifications can also be enabled to remind goal-setters when
to do things or even just nudge you to open the app and check in on where
you're at that day. The free version of this goal-tracking app allows you to
track five habits at a time, but the premium version lets you track up to 100.

Loop Habit Tracker

8

## Loop Habit Tracker

 _Free_

DOWNLOAD NOW

How satisfying does it feel to check something off of your to-do list? With
Loop's goal-tracking app, the more good habits you set for yourself, the more
you'll _want_ to do them.

This free, open-source Android app is touted by users for its simple design
and intuitive setup, and there are no annoying pop-ups or advertisements
anywhere on the screen. Just check each task off as you do it to complete the
“loop” that’s next to each of your goals.

This app displays progress in both a checklist and a chart setup, so you can
see your daily frequency, as well as your month-over-month progress. You can
also choose whether to set notifications at specific times to give you that
push in the right direction.

Streaks

9

## Streaks

 _$4.99 for lifetime access_

DOWNLOAD NOW

While some of these apps let you track tons of habits at once, Streaks puts an
emphasis on your most vital dozen. It's focused on daily and weekly habit-
tracking (rather than occasional activities), so it's ideal for those who want
to take active steps to quit smoking, burn calories, practice an instrument,
or learn a new language. ****

Reviewers love this paid app for its attractive and highly customizable user
interface (you can change the color scheme, button icons, and even the app's
icon on your home screen). Plus, it's completely integrated with the iOS
Health app, so all of your health- and fitness-related progress transfers
right over for easy access and analysis.

Productive

10

## Productive

 _Free, or $6.99/month, $29.99/year_

DOWNLOAD NOW

Productive is another iPhone-only app that prioritizes habit streaks over
sporadic goal-tracking. Under each goal in the dashboard, it lists how many
days you've reached in your streak (based on the parameters that you've set),
motivating you to keep your numbers up.

The free version starts beginners off with just five goals, the ability to set
time-of-day reminders, and some generalized streak statistics, which may be
more than enough for you!

However, if you're a total data-head, the paid version is very much worth the
investment, as you can dig into each goal and track week-over-week progress.
It also unlocks unlimited tracking, enhanced privacy settings, and more
granular habit stats.

Trello

11

## Trello

 _Free_

DOWNLOAD NOW

For those who have more of a project-manager mindset, Trello is a great app
that keeps all of your to-dos (as well as your team’s or family’s) in one
convenient place that’s accessible from your device or desktop.  

Reviewers like using it not only for work tasks but for keeping an ongoing
list of personal habits on the agenda at all times. You can set recurring
reminders, color-code types of tasks, and schedule future events to set you up
for success. It's also quite handy if you alternate between a desktop and a
device throughout the day.

As a collaborative tool, Trello also allows you to delegate responsibilities
and check out in real time which tasks need to get done, whether you're
planning a road trip, a home project, or coordinating tasks with a remote-
based team.

The free version is great for individuals who just want its organizational
functionality — you can create 10 boards with unlimited cards and lists within
it. The paid versions are better-suited for multiuser business teams.
